edu.harvard.chs.cite
[Groovy] Class CitationTriplet

java.lang.Object
  edu.harvard.chs.cite.CitationTriplet

class CitationTriplet

A CitationTriplet is the object representation of the three pieces of information mapping a given level of a citation scheme onto a validating schema. A set of CitationTriplets define a hierarchical citation scheme. CitationTriplets are composed of a labelling String, and two XPath templates (that is, Strings in which '?' represent variables that can be substituted by the value of one level of the citation hierarchy). The scopePattern XPath template defines the ancestor XPath for a given level of the work, while the leafPattern XPath template defines the citation structure of the leaf node of this level of the citation hierarchy. TBD: regular expressions should be pre compiled and documented.

Property Summary
java.lang.Object attrStringRegEx

Regular expression to get the whole attribute filter pattern contained between square brackets []
java.lang.Object elemNameRegEx

Regular expression to extract the name of an element from an XPath expression or template..
java.lang.String label

A human readable label for a citation triplet.
java.lang.String labelSeparator

String value to use as separator in label expressions.
java.lang.String leafPattern

An XPath template defining, within the ancestors defined by scopePattern, a single citation node.
java.lang.Object queryPatternVariableRegEx

Regular Expression to extract, from a filter list, the key of the key=value pair matching '?'

java.lang.String scopePattern

An XPath expression for the scope where the template pattern leafPattern applies.
java.lang.String terminalNodePattern

An optional XPath template defining, within the ancestors defined by scopePattern, citation (terminal) nodes at a higher level of the hierarchy than the leaf level.

Method Detail

allowsTerminalNode

boolean allowsTerminalNode()
Determines if this triplet allows citable content at this level of the citation scheme.
Returns:
True if citable content allowed.

ancestorPath

java.lang.String ancestorPath(java.lang.String nsPrefix)
Creates an Xpath expression by stripping citation variable patterns out of a template expression for ancestor nodes at the level of the citation hierarchy represented by this triplet. If nsPrefix is neither null nor an empty string, each node in the XPath expression will be explicitly prefixed with this identifier.
Parameters:
nsPrefix - An XML namespace identifier to apply to each node in the XPath expression.
Returns:
A String with the XPath expression.

java.lang.String asXpath()
Creates an XPath expression to extract from a document all nodes matching this citation mapping.
returns:
The resulting XPath expression.

returns:
The resulting XPath expression.
Parameters:
nsPrefix - An XML namespace identifier to apply to each node in the XPath expression.

extractLeafVariableAttribute

static java.lang.String extractLeafVariableAttribute(java.lang.String s)
From an Xpath template, extracts the name of the variable in the pattern " variable = '?' ".
returns:
A String with the name of the variable attribute encoding citation values.
Parameters:
s - The XPath template to consider.
